pr_title: Ignore null or blank string-valued span attributes.

timeline.message: Ignore null or blank string-valued span attributes.
also ignore null & blank strings on active span attributes.

timeline.bodyText: Do we want to count this as dropped or we simply ignore?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: it's definitely a different kind of "dropping" than the "too many attributes" kind. I think ignoring it is fine..it's not really an attribute at all without a value.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: Fine with this for the moment, may be unexpected for users especially for empty.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

timeline.bodyText: What is the behavior for AttributeValue.stringAttributeValue(value) in case a null string is passed?
timeline.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: that remains the same. If you're trying to create an AttributeValue with a null, you'll get the usual NPE.
replies.author: jkwatson

replies.bodyText: I think this is unexpected result and inconsistent, maybe we should try to see how we can offer the same behavior.
replies.author: bogdandrutu

replies.bodyText: that's a fair comment. I think we can do this by allowing null/empty in the AttributeValue, and then ignoring when we try to add. I'll change this PR to do it that way.
replies.author: jkwatson

timeline.message: change to ignore at the AttributeValue level, rather than above
